page.title: 03Barns on Upper Lutheredge.
page.content: There is a big barn which was built in{1948. }In {1981}it was burnt down by vandals.The fire was not discovered until the early hours of the morning, when a glow was seen on the horizon. It was rebuilt and now they are building an extension to the barn. The barn can hold{1000}tonnes of corn. The older barns were built about 1850.There are some old cart horse stables where the wagons and traps were kept.They are now used as extra barns for storage and agricultural machinery. After the second World War building materials were scarce and they purchased an old tin chapel with typical windows in it.Ponies are kept in there during the Winter. The Cotswold stone pigsty is now a greenhouse.
